column5: Had to swing into the park on the way home today and snap a couple of shots...
we're you parked there for the last pic? every creek I went past today all through Markham was a flood too...
Wow, that's some fast moving water. Won't be long and you can wet your line....  Dirk....
I think everything in Southern Ontario will be blown out...  I can't imagine what the Geen look like, or the Notty for that matter.
i cross the credit daily up on creditview past britannia and man, she was raging today and overflowed the banks.  hope people are smart enough to stay away.

Last night I drove buy 16 mile creek in Oakville right by the Go station. There was a mud line still left in the snow about 15ft higher than the river level last night. That would have been something to see. Will check it out tonight as I think the river surged and let loose last night but should be very high again this afternoon.
That's a pretty raging torrent!!  They outta clear up them ice breakers...
Lucky i  got my steelhead fix in yesterday morning on some prime water
guess I won't be hitting the cerit tomorrow thanks for the update
wow that is insane!!!  cheers!
I spy a steelhead!!!
Guess I should have called that "iced in" bet with Sinker ! lol
I saw the lineup of cars that couldn't get down Bayview cause the Humber was flooded. And apparently some cyclist was trapped by the flooding for like 5 hours too.
Thanks for posting. I can only imagine what the lower sections are like. There go my Monday plans, maybe the week after
WOW! crazy I'm guessing about 2 weeks
i guess im going to the fishing show instead this weekend

the ice jam at the paper mill was almost 2k long, the top of the non funcitoning dam there is a 10 foot head and it was covered by 2 feet of water it was a serious ice jam for sure..  But this does mean 1 thing.........Steelies will be in reports in the next week
16MILE has dynamited itself not to sure about 12 mile though I would imagine.....here fishy fishy
Yes You know were I am going next week LOL Jose
steel time ladies and gents!   i should be on the river by monday!...  not that river though
